column1: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!////Let me say that I have spent time in Spain and have had authentic tapas
column2: paella and sangria.  The red sangria was delicious and not overpriced ($18 for a nice sized pitcher that at least got my date buzzed).  For tapas we just ordered the Spanish sausages and bacon wrapped dates
column3: which were both tasty and decently priced.  The seafood paella
column5: left a lot to be desired.  The portions were way to small for the price and it did not taste authentic at all.  It was very bland and a bit soggy.
